data.q: Which technique reduces the number of times a function is executed during rapid events like scrolling?
data.e: Debouncing delays execution until events stop firing, reducing unnecessary function calls.

data.q: What does memoization help optimize in JavaScript?
o: Repeated function calls with the same inputs
data.e: Memoization caches results of function calls to avoid recomputation.

data.q: Which method improves performance by loading resources only when they are needed?
data.e: Lazy loading defers resource loading until they are required, improving initial load time.

data.q: Which practice reduces JavaScript file size for faster downloads?
data.e: Minification removes unnecessary characters like whitespace and comments to reduce file size.

data.q: Which browser API helps measure performance metrics like load times?
data.e: The Performance API provides methods to measure and analyze page performance.

data.q: Which technique reduces reflows and repaints when updating the DOM?
data.e: Batching DOM updates minimizes layout recalculations and improves rendering performance.

data.q: Which strategy improves performance by serving cached responses instead of recomputing or refetching?
data.e: Caching stores frequently used data or responses to avoid repeated computation or network requests.
